1.text: Feel for bumpy skin to verify your avocado’s ripeness.

2.text: Place the avocado in a brown paper bag to ripen it.

3.text: Check the avocado every day until it becomes ripe.

4.text: Put your avocado in an airtight plastic bag.

5.text: Squeeze the air out before sealing the bag’s zipper.

6.text: Place the avocado in the refrigerator to store it for 3-5 days.

7.text: Set your sliced avocado out on a cutting board or paper towel.

8.text: Brush any exposed surfaces of the fruit with lemon juice.

9.text: Put your avocado back into its original shape if you can.

10.text: Wrap the avocado in plastic wrap to seal it.

11.text: Store your fruit in the refrigerator for 3-5 days.

12.text: Store a ripe or unripe avocado in the freezer if you can’t use it.

13.text: Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit and skin.

14.text: Brush every exposed surface of the avocado with lemon juice.

15.text: Wrap the avocado tightly with plastic wrap.

16.text: Store the avocado in the freezer for 3-6 months.
